summary: This document is an email chain from August 13-14, 2019, between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel discussing the need to prepare forfeiture options regarding Jeffrey Epstein's properties and managing expectations following his death.

events.title: Forfeiture options summary deadline
events.description: A summary of forfeiture options regarding Jeffrey Epstein's properties needed by Thursday morning.

events.title: Discussion of pursuing residences
events.description: Prosecutors discuss pursuing a theory to target residences in New York, Florida, and the Virgin Islands for forfeiture.

keyFacts: The email chain discusses preparing forfeiture options for Jeffrey Epstein's properties following his death.
Prosecutors are seeking a 'cognizable theory' to pursue residences in New York, Florida, and the Virgin Islands.
The correspondence indicates urgency, with a deadline set for Thursday morning (August 15, 2019).
The emails reference the need for an 'expectations-managing meeting' the day after Epstein's death.
All sender/recipient names are redacted, shown only by office designations (USANYS).
